name: Apothecary Initiate
text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Kithkin jealously hoard their knowledge of poultices and remedies so that no outside threat can benefit from their wisdom.

name: Armored Ascension
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Plains you control and has flying.
flavor: "Why enchant feathers to make them sturdy when we can enchant shields to make them fly?"\n—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Ballynock Cohort
text: First strike\nBallynock Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another white creature.
flavor: A kithkin's worst enemy is solitude.

name: Barrenton Medic
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.\nPut a -1/-1 counter on Barrenton Medic: Untap Barrenton Medic.
flavor: His dreams are filled with noxious powders and clinking vials.

name: Boon Reflection
text: If you would gain life, you gain twice that much life instead.
flavor: Kithkin healers chant the clan songs of both their parents over the broth to double its curative effect.

name: Goldenglow Moth
text: Flying\nWhenever Goldenglow Moth blocks, you may gain 4 life.
flavor: Ordinary moths follow it, drawn to its light.

name: Greater Auramancy
text: Other enchantments you control have shroud. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)\nEnchanted creatures you control have shroud.
flavor: A delicate veil of glamers can prove as sturdy as iron.

name: Inquisitor's Snare
text: Prevent all damage target attacking or blocking creature would deal this turn. If that creature is black or red, destroy it.
flavor: Driven by their paranoia, kithkin inflict on their foes all the agonies they believe would have been inflicted on them.

name: Kithkin Rabble
text: Vigilance\nKithkin Rabble's power and toughness are each equal to the number of white permanents you control.
flavor: If even the slightest hint of panic enters the thoughtweft, bakers, potters, and even medics drop their spoons and salves to take up arms.

name: Kithkin Shielddare
text: {W}, {T}: Target blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The nova glyph is a potent symbol. A shield embossed with it can resist the force of even the most determined giant.

name: Last Breath
text: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.
flavor: "Tsk. You'd think those nasty merrows would know how to hold their breath."\n—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Mass Calcify
text: Destroy all nonwhite creatures.
flavor: The dead serve as their own tombstones.

name: Mine Excavation
text: Return target artifact or enchantment card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Mistmeadow Skulk
text: Lifelink, protection from converted mana cost 3 or greater
flavor: Doyo suspected the boggarts of brewing a plot against his crop, so he scythed away his grain to clear the sightlines.

name: Niveous Wisps
text: Target creature becomes white until end of turn. Tap that creature.\nDraw a card.
flavor: In a world devoid of sun, illumination comes from cheerless fires or the wandering spirits of the dead.

name: Order of Whiteclay
text: {1}{W}{W}, {Q}: Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Made from the clay of burial mounds, the face paint of the priests is a sign of their respect for those whose rest they interrupt.

name: Pale Wayfarer
text: {2}{W}{W}, {Q}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: As it wandered Shadowmoor, it did not remember its crime—only its shame.

name: Prison Term
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.\nWhenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may attach Prison Term to that creature.
flavor: Clear out the cell. Bring in the next prisoner.

name: Resplendent Mentor
text: White creatures you control have "{T}: You gain 1 life."
flavor: Thoughtweft gives new meaning to the phrase "common knowledge."

name: Rune-Cervin Rider
text: Flying\n{G/W}{G/W}: Rune-Cervin Rider gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Things of beauty are in constant peril. The riders whisk them to safety, ahead of the encroaching darkness.

name: Runed Halo
text: As Runed Halo enters the battlefield, name a card.\nYou have protection from the chosen name. (You can't be targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything with that name.)

name: Safehold Sentry
text: {2}{W}, {Q}: Safehold Sentry gets +0/+2 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: "These bracers were worn by my father and by his mother before him. Boggart fangs have shattered on them. Cinder flames have withered at their touch. While I wear them, the safehold will not fall."

name: Spectral Procession
text: Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
flavor: "The dead have it easy. They suffer no more. If breaking their rest helps the living, so be it."\n—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Strip Bare
text: Destroy all Auras and Equipment attached to target creature.
flavor: "All glamers lifted, all lies revealed, all flesh exposed."\n—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Twilight Shepherd
text: Flying, vigilance\nWhen Twilight Shepherd enters the battlefield, return to your hand all cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Windbrisk Raptor
text: Flying\nAttacking creatures you control have lifelink.
flavor: It awakened to gloom-fouled skies and responded with a righteous rage that shook the heavens.

name: Woeleecher
text: {W}, {T}: Remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature. If you do, you gain 2 life.
flavor: One head senses the curse. The second loosens it from the soul. The third drinks it as an invigorating mist.

name: Advice from the Fae
text: ({2/U} can be paid with any two mana or with {U}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)\nLook at the top five cards of your library. If you control more creatures than each other player, put two of those cards into your hand. Otherwise, put one of them into your hand. Then put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Biting Tether
text: Enchant creature\nYou control enchanted creature.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: A chain of lies as strong as steel.

name: Briarberry Cohort
text: Flying\nBriarberry Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another blue creature.
flavor: A clique can cause far more mischief than one faerie on its own.

name: Cerulean Wisps
text: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn. Untap that creature.\nDraw a card.
flavor: "If you see ghostly lights by the river, eat three twigs of marshroot to ward off kelpies."\n—Kithkin superstition

name: Consign to Dream
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. If that permanent is red or green, put it on top of its owner's library instead.
flavor: "Dreams are fleeting. Reality even more so."\n—Oona, queen of the fae

name: Counterbore
text: Counter target spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Cursecatcher
text: Sacrifice Cursecatcher: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: "Of all the things that can be stolen, opportunity is the most valuable."

name: Deepchannel Mentor
text: Blue creatures you control can't be blocked.
flavor: The rivers can no longer provide safe passage for travelers and commerce. They serve only as highways for raiders and channels for blood and woe.

name: Drowner Initiate
text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: Nothing satisfies a merrow as much as drowning what it cannot have.

name: Faerie Swarm
text: Flying\nFaerie Swarm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of blue permanents you control.
flavor: Untouched by the Aurora, Oona's faeries greeted the night like any other day.

name: Flow of Ideas
text: Draw a card for each Island you control.
flavor: "Beware the merrows, whose envy and covetousness surpasses even that of the ravenous whirlpools where they dwell."\n—The Book of Other Folk

name: Ghastly Discovery
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it.)
flavor: Korrigans, spirits bound to sources of water, shriek when they come upon their own drowned corpses.

name: Isleback Spawn
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)\nIsleback Spawn gets +4/+8 as long as a library has twenty or fewer cards in it.
flavor: The more deadly the lake monster, the shorter the tale.

name: Kinscaer Harpoonist
text: Flying\nWhenever Kinscaer Harpoonist attacks, you may have target creature lose flying until end of turn.
flavor: The suspicious kithkin of Kinscaer patrol the skies, their eyes attuned to the shapes of outsiders.

name: Knacksaw Clique
text: Flying\n{1}{U}, {Q}: Target opponent exiles the top card of his or her library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Most of the Knacksaw clique's skills were hewn from the minds of others.

name: Leech Bonder
text: Leech Bonder enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.\n{U}, {Q}: Move a counter from target creature onto a second target creature. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Some don't know his face, but his pets are a dead giveaway.

name: Merrow Wavebreakers
text: {1}{U}, {Q}: Merrow Wavebreakers gains flying until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: The merrows' prey have retreated from the shore, so they have learned to follow.

name: Parapet Watchers
text: {W/U}: Parapet Watchers gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: A kithkin doun is not so much a town as a fortress, built to withstand the constantly besieging darkness. Only those most watchful and trustworthy are tasked with guarding its walls.

name: Prismwake Merrow
text: Flash\nWhen Prismwake Merrow enters the battlefield, target permanent becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: "Seeing is believing" is a fact the merrows ruthlessly exploit in their dealings with the other residents of Shadowmoor.

name: Puca's Mischief
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent an opponent controls with an equal or lesser converted mana cost.

name: Put Away
text: Counter target spell. You may shuffle up to one target card from your graveyard into your library.
flavor: Kithkin spellbottlers spend half their time preserving old memories and the other half punishing the new.

name: River Kelpie
text: Whenever River Kelpie or another permanent enters the battlefield from a graveyard, draw a card.\nWhenever a player casts a spell from a graveyard, draw a card.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Savor the Moment
text: Take an extra turn after this one. Skip the untap step of that turn.
flavor: The merrow took a moment for herself. She never gave it back.

name: Sinking Feeling
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.\nEnchanted creature has "{1}, Put a -1/-1 counter on this creature: Untap this creature."

name: Spell Syphon
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each blue permanent you control.
flavor: Warrik Brutehexer felt betrayed that his aura favored the depths of the Wanderbrine River over its rightful place, hovering around him.

name: Thought Reflection
text: If you would draw a card, draw two cards instead.
flavor: Knowledge fills the mind of a fool and opens the mind of the sage.

name: Whimwader
text: Whimwader can't attack unless defending player controls a blue permanent.
flavor: "Thought? Deceit? Progress? Now you're just making it hungry."\n—Abral, kithkin alchemist

name: Aphotic Wisps
text: Target creature becomes black and gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\nDraw a card.
flavor: Merrows skulk the silty bogs around the Wanderbrine, their very thoughts stained with evil.

name: Ashenmoor Cohort
text: Ashenmoor Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another black creature.
flavor: "None will concede a place for us in this world. If it is not for us, neither shall it be for them. We rest not until they choke in its cold ashes."\n—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Beseech the Queen
text: ({2/B} can be paid with any two mana or with {B}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)\nSearch your library for a card with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of lands you control, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Those who hear her go mad with inspiration.

name: Blowfly Infestation
text: Whenever a creature dies, if it had a -1/-1 counter on it, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: When the giant Tollek Worldslayer fell, a corruption erupted from his corpse to carry on his name.

name: Cinderbones
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\n{1}{B}: Regenerate Cinderbones.
flavor: Not all coals lie quietly in their beds of cold ash.

name: Cinderhaze Wretch
text: {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.\nPut a -1/-1 counter on Cinderhaze Wretch: Untap Cinderhaze Wretch.
flavor: Thick smoke billows and twists to form disturbing faces that cackle and click their teeth to the popping embers.

name: Corrosive Mentor
text: Black creatures you control have wither. (They deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: Guttering cinders stoke their dying flames by snuffing out the lights of others.

name: Corrupt
text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.

name: Crowd of Cinders
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\nCrowd of Cinders's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black permanents you control.
flavor: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

name: Disturbing Plot
text: Return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Dusk Urchins
text: Whenever Dusk Urchins attacks or blocks, put a -1/-1 counter on it.\nWhen Dusk Urchins dies, draw a card for each -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor: They spawn from shadow, wreaking chaos until shadow claims them again.

name: Faerie Macabre
text: Flying\nDiscard Faerie Macabre: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards.
flavor: The line between dream and death is gauzy and fragile. She leads those too near it from one side to the other.

name: Gloomlance
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was green or white, its controller discards a card.
flavor: Death stings the victim only once, but those left behind feel the pain of loss with every passing memory.

name: Hollowborn Barghest
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, each opponent loses 2 life.\nAt the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has no cards in hand, he or she loses 2 life.
flavor: It leaves a trail of crumpled trees and dashed dreams.

name: Hollowsage
text: Whenever Hollowsage becomes untapped, you may have target player discard a card.
flavor: Dreams of dark nights to come are said to stir in the minds of scheming hollowsages.

name: Incremental Blight
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, two -1/-1 counters on another target creature, and three -1/-1 counters on a third target creature.
flavor: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.

name: Loch Korrigan
text: {U/B}: Loch Korrigan gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Don't look upon still waters without first breaking the surface. The korrigan will catch you with her gaze and drag you to your death."\n—Kithkin superstition

name: Midnight Banshee
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each nonblack creature.
flavor: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.

name: Plague of Vermin
text: Starting with you, each player may pay any amount of life. Repeat this process until no one pays life. Each player puts a 1/1 black Rat creature token onto the battlefield for each 1 life he or she paid this way.

name: Polluted Bonds
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, that player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor: The mystic bond between spellcasters and the land is just as vulnerable to attack as the casters themselves.

name: Puppeteer Clique
text: Flying\nWhen Puppeteer Clique enters the battlefield, put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. At the beginning of your next end step, exile it.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Rite of Consumption
text: As an additional cost to cast Rite of Consumption, sacrifice a creature.\nRite of Consumption deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

name: Sickle Ripper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.

name: Smolder Initiate
text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life.
flavor: "Life is a circle. Death is a vicious circle."

name: Splitting Headache
text: Choose one —\n• Target player discards two cards.\n• Target player reveals his or her hand, you choose a card from it, then that player discards that card.
flavor: All faeries delve for dreams. But not all wait for their victims to fall asleep.

name: Torture
text: Enchant creature\n{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: What the vigor of life builds up, agony tears down again.

name: Wound Reflection
text: At the beginning of each end step, each opponent loses life equal to the life he or she lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)
flavor: The mission of the Nighthearth, Illulia's cult of murderous cinders, is to intensify every pain suffered in Shadowmoor.

name: Blistering Dieflyn
text: Flying\n{B/R}: Blistering Dieflyn gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Any kithkin smith would love to catch a dieflyn for her kiln, relieving her of ever having to gather fuel again.

name: Bloodmark Mentor
text: Red creatures you control have first strike.
flavor: Boggarts divide the world into two categories: things you can eat, and things you have to chase down and pummel before you can eat.

name: Bloodshed Fever
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature attacks each turn if able.
flavor: Cinder mages enjoy seeing their victims in the throes of bloodlust—and seeing the regret that inevitably follows.

name: Boggart Arsonists
text: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)\n{2}{R}, Sacrifice Boggart Arsonists: Destroy target Scarecrow or Plains.
flavor: The Aurora transformed Nibb and Gyik from mischief-makers into feral marauders. They still don't know much about tool safety.

name: Burn Trail
text: Burn Trail deals 3 damage to target creature or player.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Cragganwick Cremator
text: When Cragganwick Cremator enters the battlefield, discard a card at random. If you discard a creature card this way, Cragganwick Cremator deals damage equal to that card's power to target player.
flavor: Each night that his bowl fills, a village mourns.

name: Crimson Wisps
text: Target creature becomes red and gains haste until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
flavor: The whispers are incomprehensible, yet cinders always hear a message of urgency.

name: Deep-Slumber Titan
text: Deep-Slumber Titan enters the battlefield tapped.\nDeep-Slumber Titan doesn't untap during your untap step.\nWhenever Deep-Slumber Titan is dealt damage, untap it.
flavor: Do not disturb.

name: Elemental Mastery
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has "{T}: Put X 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield, where X is this creature's power. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step."

name: Ember Gale
text: Creatures target player controls can't block this turn. Ember Gale deals 1 damage to each white and/or blue creature that player controls.
flavor: "Terrible wind. It whipped sparks into our skin, then stoked them even hotter!"\n—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Flame Javelin
text: ({2/R} can be paid with any two mana or with {R}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)\nFlame Javelin deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Gyara Spearhurler would have been renowned for her deadly accuracy, if it weren't for her deadly accuracy.

name: Furystoke Giant
text: When Furystoke Giant enters the battlefield, other creatures you control gain "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature or player" until end of turn.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Horde of Boggarts
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)\nHorde of Boggarts's power and toughness are each equal to the number of red permanents you control.
flavor: Strategies don't come easily to the boggarts' feral minds, but full-on assault hasn't failed them yet.

name: Inescapable Brute
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nInescapable Brute must be blocked if able.
flavor: If you think you made it past him alive, he's just teasing you.

name: Intimidator Initiate
text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: Don't stand in his way, for his way is full of pointy things and fire.

name: Jaws of Stone
text: Jaws of Stone deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players, where X is the number of Mountains you control as you cast Jaws of Stone.
flavor: When giants find their mountain homes infested, they have a whole range of solutions.

name: Knollspine Dragon
text: Flying\nWhen Knollspine Dragon enters the battlefield, you may discard your hand and draw cards equal to the damage dealt to target opponent this turn.
flavor: It woke to find a vast world in need of a master.

name: Knollspine Invocation
text: {X}, Discard a card with converted mana cost X: Knollspine Invocation deals X damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Witches tempted by the power of flame gathered to study in the ruins of Spinerock Knoll.

name: Mudbrawler Cohort
text: Haste\nMudbrawler Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another red creature.
flavor: Before a raid, the members of Wort's gang egg each other on with tales of their hunger and what they'll do to sate it, each outdoing the last.

name: Power of Fire
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
flavor: The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.

name: Puncture Bolt
text: Puncture Bolt deals 1 damage to target creature. Put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
flavor: Cinder pyromancers measure their success by counting their enemies' smoking holes.

name: Pyre Charger
text: Haste\n{R}: Pyre Charger gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: His blade was forged over coals of moaning treefolk, curved at the optimum angle for severing heads, and heated to volcanic temperatures by his touch.

name: Rage Reflection
text: Creatures you control have double strike.
flavor: Vengeance is a dish best served twice.

name: Rustrazor Butcher
text: First strike\nWither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: A Bloodwort's blade is salted with blood and peppered with rust, seasoning and slaughtering in a single swipe.

name: Slinking Giant
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nWhenever Slinking Giant blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: "I need a better hiding place."

name: Smash to Smithereens
text: Destroy target artifact. Smash to Smithereens deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.
flavor: The giant Tarvik dreamed that trinkets and machines caused all the world's woe. When he awoke from his troubled sleep, he took the name Tarvik Relicsmasher.

name: Wild Swing
text: Choose three target nonenchantment permanents. Destroy one of them at random.
flavor: Though the shaman rarely got what she wanted, she was never disappointed in the result.

name: Crabapple Cohort
text: Crabapple Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another green creature.
flavor: Seven wives made seven pies from seven apples, each plucked from its branches. Now bare and bitter, it comes to exact its price: one apple, one bone.

name: Devoted Druid
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\nPut a -1/-1 counter on Devoted Druid: Untap Devoted Druid.
flavor: "Mana lurks in all things, even in the depths of one's own heart."

name: Dramatic Entrance
text: You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: Some things aren't worth waiting for.

name: Drove of Elves
text: Hexproof\nDrove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.
flavor: "The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness."

name: Farhaven Elf
text: When Farhaven Elf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
flavor: "Verdant bloom does exist. It merely hides for its own safety."

name: Flourishing Defenses
text: Whenever a -1/-1 counter is placed on a creature, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: Many horrors take the bait of brave elf volunteers walking alone, only to fall to the blades of rescuers lurking nearby.

name: Foxfire Oak
text: {R/G}{R/G}{R/G}: Foxfire Oak gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "The brethren shall blaze with unnatural fire, and the flame shall consume and purify our rage."\n—Treefolk catastrophe myth

name: Gleeful Sabotage
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Gloomwidow
text: Reach\nGloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: When gloomwidows mature, they abandon venom in favor of massive webs that span the eaves of cliffs.

name: Gloomwidow's Feast
text: Destroy target creature with flying. If that creature was blue or black, put a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach onto the battlefield. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Each night, gloomwidows cull fresh prey for their ravenous hatchlings.

name: Howl of the Night Pack
text: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control.
flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

name: Hungry Spriggan
text: Trample\nWhenever Hungry Spriggan attacks, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: If a spriggan's eyes are larger than its stomach, it has ways to remedy the situation.

name: Juvenile Gloomwidow
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)\nWither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: Gloomwidow venom is particularly virulent during the spider's first years, when it does most of its hunting near the forest floor.

name: Mana Reflection
text: If you tap a permanent for mana, it produces twice as much of that mana instead.
flavor: Despite its darkness, Shadowmoor doesn't want for growth. Legions of creeping things thrive in the shade.

name: Mossbridge Troll
text: If Mossbridge Troll would be destroyed, regenerate it.\nTap any number of untapped creatures you control other than Mossbridge Troll with total power 10 or greater: Mossbridge Troll gets +20/+20 until end of turn.

name: Nurturer Initiate
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The elves alone preserve the few shreds of beauty left. There is no one else who cares.

name: Presence of Gond
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has "{T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield."
flavor: "Here lies Gond, hero of Safehold Taldwen. May he ever guide our quest."

name: Prismatic Omen
text: Lands you control are every basic land type in addition to their other types.
flavor: In times of portent, the land sculpts itself in accordance with the sigils burned on the sky.

name: Raking Canopy
text: Whenever a creature with flying attacks you, Raking Canopy deals 4 damage to it.
flavor: "Raven's Run has awoken, and ravens will no longer cry in its branches."\n—Roon Ghastbark

name: Roughshod Mentor
text: Green creatures you control have trample.
flavor: He didn't hear the cries of the treefolk whose branches he snapped or of the elves caught underfoot. He had eyes only for the path ahead.

name: Spawnwrithe
text: Trample\nWhenever Spawnwrithe deals combat damage to a player, put a token that's a copy of Spawnwrithe onto the battlefield.
flavor: Its victims feel only an itchy, wriggling feeling just under their skin. By then, it's far too late.

name: Toil to Renown
text: You gain 1 life for each tapped artifact, creature, and land you control.
flavor: The last survivor of her patrol, the warrior returned expecting disappointment and scorn. Instead she found gratitude. "You are alive. That is reason to celebrate."

name: Tower Above
text: ({2/G} can be paid with any two mana or with {G}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)\nUntil end of turn, target creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample, wither, and "When this creature attacks, target creature blocks it this turn if able." (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Viridescent Wisps
text: Target creature becomes green and gets +1/+0 until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
flavor: In the wisps that night, the once timid boggart saw all the terrible, bloody things he was capable of. And it was glorious.

name: Wildslayer Elves
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: Some elves battled too long in the deep shadow, their swords dipped too often in tainted flesh and poisoned blood.

name: Witherscale Wurm
text: Whenever Witherscale Wurm blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nWhenever Witherscale Wurm deals damage to an opponent, remove all -1/-1 counters from it.

name: Woodfall Primus
text: Trample\nWhen Woodfall Primus enters the battlefield, destroy target noncreature permanent.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Æthertow
text: Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Augury Adept
text: Whenever Augury Adept deals combat damage to a player, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor: Moonstones grant limited foresight but unlimited advantages.

name: Barrenton Cragtreads
text: Barrenton Cragtreads can't be blocked by red creatures.
flavor: "Boggarts are easy to get around. Just toss some mutton in another direction. Giants are a little harder. You have to be quick to avoid their steps. Cinders are the difficult ones, but even they have fears to be exploited."

name: Curse of Chains
text: Enchant creature\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, tap enchanted creature.
flavor: The giant's real punishment was the fleeting moment when he was allowed to stand before being dragged down to his knees again.

name: Enchanted Evening
text: All permanents are enchantments in addition to their other types.
flavor: In the reflection, she saw the rough shell of the world sloughing away, revealing the truth shining underneath.

name: Glamer Spinners
text: Flash\nFlying\nWhen Glamer Spinners enters the battlefield, attach all Auras enchanting target permanent to another permanent with the same controller.

name: Godhead of Awe
text: Flying\nOther creatures have base power and toughness 1/1.
flavor: "What she saw crawling upon this world repulsed her. Yet she could not tear her gaze away."\n—The Seer's Parables

name: Mirrorweave
text: Each other creature becomes a copy of target nonlegendary creature until end of turn.
flavor: "Those who are different are untrustworthy, unpredictable. Put your safety in the hands of your own kind."\n—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Mistmeadow Witch
text: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.

name: Plumeveil
text: Flash\nDefender, flying
flavor: "It was vast, a great sheet of soaring wings, and equally silent. It caught us unawares and blocked our view of the kithkin stronghold."\n—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Puresight Merrow
text: {W/U}, {Q}: Look at the top card of your library. You may exile that card. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Stripped of his sight, he was free to see only the ideal.

name: Repel Intruders
text: Put two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield if {W} was spent to cast Repel Intruders. Counter up to one target creature spell if {U} was spent to cast Repel Intruders. (Do both if {W}{U} was spent.)

name: Silkbind Faerie
text: Flying\n{1}{W/U}, {Q}: Tap target creature. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: "The bigger they are, the more fun it is to watch them fall flat on their faces."

name: Somnomancer
text: When Somnomancer enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.
flavor: "Are you tired? You look tired."

name: Steel of the Godhead
text: Enchant creature\nAs long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)\nAs long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked.

name: Swans of Bryn Argoll
text: Flying\nIf a source would deal damage to Swans of Bryn Argoll, prevent that damage. The source's controller draws cards equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor: Any being that harms them quickly learns its lesson.

name: Thistledown Duo
text: Whenever you cast a white spell, Thistledown Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nWhenever you cast a blue spell, Thistledown Duo gains flying until end of turn.

name: Thistledown Liege
text: Flash\nOther white creatures you control get +1/+1.\nOther blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: The thoughtweft is his informant, and he its devoted guardian.

name: Thoughtweft Gambit
text: Tap all creatures your opponents control and untap all creatures you control.
flavor: The kithkin mind-bond is even tighter in Shadowmoor, reinforcing the unity of their community to the point of xenophobia.

name: Turn to Mist
text: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "Did you expect me to dodge? How quaint."\n—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Worldpurge
text: Return all permanents to their owners' hands. Each player chooses up to seven cards in his or her hand, then shuffles the rest into his or her library. Empty all mana pools.
flavor: The Aurora is not the only magic capable of remaking a world.

name: Zealous Guardian
text: Flash
flavor: Parapet watchers patrol the outer edges of the doun, signaling to others who wait patiently in shadow.

name: Cemetery Puca
text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, Cemetery Puca becomes a copy of that creature and gains this ability.
flavor: "'Tis a strange creature indeed that chooses the vanquished over the victor."\n—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Dire Undercurrents
text: Whenever a blue creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have target player draw a card.\nWhenever a black creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have target player discard a card.

name: Dream Salvage
text: Draw cards equal to the number of cards target opponent discarded this turn.
flavor: Awylla tried hard to forget the horrors she had seen, but someone else had developed a keen interest in them.

name: Fate Transfer
text: Move all counters from target creature onto another target creature.
flavor: "The cinders find strength in suffering, the elves in beauty. But if you make an elf suffer, he gets weaker. I wonder what happens if you make a cinder beautiful?"\n—Hrugash, leech bonder

name: Ghastlord of Fugue
text: Ghastlord of Fugue can't be blocked.\nWhenever Ghastlord of Fugue deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player exiles that card.
flavor: "He is a ghost that has never known life."\n—The Seer's Parables

name: Glen Elendra Liege
text: Flying\nOther blue creatures you control get +1/+1.\nOther black creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: Those who displease Oona soon learn the extent of the armies she commands.

name: Gravelgill Axeshark
text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
flavor: "Their sharp scales would make good armor, if they'd just stay dead."\n—Taeryn, cinder armorkeep

name: Gravelgill Duo
text: Whenever you cast a blue spell, Gravelgill Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nWhenever you cast a black spell, Gravelgill Duo gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Helm of the Ghastlord
text: Enchant creature\nAs long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."\nAs long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +1/+1 and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card."

name: Inkfathom Infiltrator
text: Inkfathom Infiltrator can't block and can't be blocked.
flavor: No one can navigate the dank maze of Shadowmoor's rivers better than the cruel and covetous merrows. They use the currents to steal—and to steal away.

name: Inkfathom Witch
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\n{2}{U}{B}: Each unblocked creature has base power and toughness 4/1 until end of turn.
flavor: The murk of the Wanderbrine concealed unseemly rituals designed to bring out the worst in merrowkind.

name: Memory Plunder
text: You may cast target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Vengeance is the echo of the victim's own crime."\n—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Memory Sluice
text: Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Merrow Grimeblotter
text: {1}{U/B}, {Q}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Grimeblotters spend so much time in the Dark Meanders that they're able to bring a piece with them wherever they go.

name: Oona, Queen of the Fae
text: Flying\n{X}{U/B}: Choose a color. Target opponent exiles the top X cards of his or her library. For each card of the chosen color exiled this way, put a 1/1 blue and black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

name: Oona's Gatewarden
text: Defender, flying\nWither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: "So now you've seen Glen Elendra. Take a good look. It will be the last thing you'll ever see."

name: River's Grasp
text: If {U} was spent to cast River's Grasp, return up to one target creature to its owner's hand. If {B} was spent to cast River's Grasp, target player reveals his or her hand, you choose a nonland card from it, then that player discards that card. (Do both if {U}{B} was spent.)

name: Scarscale Ritual
text: As an additional cost to cast Scarscale Ritual, put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control.\nDraw two cards.
flavor: Some words are too important to trust to something as fragile as memory.

name: Sygg, River Cutthroat
text: At the beginning of each end step, if an opponent lost 3 or more life this turn, you may draw a card. (Damage causes loss of life.)
flavor: "It's not a matter of deserving. It's a matter of strength. The power to hold versus the power to take."

name: Torpor Dust
text: Flash\nEnchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -3/-0.
flavor: "Some folk these days are too restless to dream the dreams we need. We need to teach them to stop and catch their breath."

name: Wanderbrine Rootcutters
text: Wanderbrine Rootcutters can't be blocked by green creatures.
flavor: Most dirtwalkers only know of the vicious merrows that dwell in the shallows. They can't begin to fathom the wickedness that skulks in the Dark Meanders.

name: Wasp Lancer
text: Flying
flavor: "I doubt that faeries understand how short their lives are, compared to the rest of us. If they did, would they so readily charge into battle, heedless of the danger before them?"\n—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Ashenmoor Gouger
text: Ashenmoor Gouger can't block.
flavor: After his hands had crumbled away, leaving only wickedly sharp points, he decided his only purpose was war.

name: Ashenmoor Liege
text: Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.\nOther red creatures you control get +1/+1.\nWhenever Ashenmoor Liege becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, that player loses 4 life.
flavor: Cinders carry an ancestral grudge that makes them slow to trust and quick to retaliate.

name: Cultbrand Cinder
text: When Cultbrand Cinder enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "Your seared flesh will be the first step in your journey to dark enlightenment."

name: Demigod of Revenge
text: Flying, haste\nWhen you cast Demigod of Revenge, return all cards named Demigod of Revenge from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "His laugh, a bellowing, deathly din, slices through the heavens, making them bleed."\n—The Seer's Parables

name: Din of the Fireherd
text: Put a 5/5 black and red Elemental creature token onto the battlefield. Target opponent sacrifices a creature for each black creature you control, then sacrifices a land for each red creature you control.
flavor: Vengeance in stampede form.

name: Emberstrike Duo
text: Whenever you cast a black spell, Emberstrike Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nWhenever you cast a red spell, Emberstrike Duo gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Everlasting Torment
text: Players can't gain life.\nDamage can't be prevented.\nAll damage is dealt as though its source had wither. (A source with wither deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: When night fell, the plane itself was scarred.

name: Fists of the Demigod
text: Enchant creature\nAs long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +1/+1 and has wither. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nAs long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

name: Fulminator Mage
text: Sacrifice Fulminator Mage: Destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor: "Unsafe Terrain Ahead—Turn Back"\n—Sign near the former location of Pyrtagh Cairn

name: Grief Tyrant
text: Grief Tyrant enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.\nWhen Grief Tyrant dies, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature for each -1/-1 counter on Grief Tyrant.

name: Kulrath Knight
text: Flying\nWither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nCreatures your opponents control with counters on them can't attack or block.
flavor: Mounted cinders circle the blasted peak at Kulrath, hunting the Extinguisher.

name: Manaforge Cinder
text: {1}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.
flavor: Cinder mystics set traps for sluaghs and other spirits of flame, seeking to extract the secrets of the fire their own hearts have lost.

name: Murderous Redcap
text: When Murderous Redcap enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Poison the Well
text: Destroy target land. Poison the Well deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
flavor: Wells that provide clean, unhaunted water are rare enough to be worth building an entire town around.

name: Scar
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "What is a scar? A sign of courage in the face of danger? A mere trick of flesh? Or a constant reminder of agonizing pain, and the follies of war."\n—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Sootstoke Kindler
text: Haste\n{T}: Target black or red creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "Nothing warms my heart better than a spirit kindled with rage."

name: Sootwalkers
text: Sootwalkers can't be blocked by white creatures.
flavor: "Why allow the fires of others to burn, when ours do not? Why leave them content, while we suffer? If there is to be misery, let it be borne by all."

name: Spiteflame Witch
text: {B}{R}: Each player loses 1 life.
flavor: Cinder beliefs revolve around the Path of Sorrow, a spiritual descent into oblivion. They don't mind taking others on their journey down.

name: Spiteful Visions
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.\nWhenever a player draws a card, Spiteful Visions deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor: Knowledge brings the sting of disillusionment, but the pain teaches perspective.

name: Torrent of Souls
text: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. (Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)

name: Traitor's Roar
text: Tap target untapped creature. It deals damage equal to its power to its controller.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Tyrannize
text: Target player discards his or her hand unless he or she pays 7 life.
flavor: "I can stab you where it hurts, or where you will feel absolutely nothing."\n—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Boartusk Liege
text: Trample\nOther red creatures you control get +1/+1.\nOther green creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: The boar leads its rider to victory in battle, but it doesn't know how close it is to becoming the victory feast.

name: Boggart Ram-Gang
text: Haste\nWither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: "We're going to need a bigger gate."\n—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Deus of Calamity
text: Trample\nWhenever Deus of Calamity deals 6 or more damage to an opponent, destroy target land that player controls.
flavor: "He bears the marks of ages upon his skin, memories of dreams long dead and best left buried."\n—The Seer's Parables

name: Firespout
text: Firespout deals 3 damage to each creature without flying if {R} was spent to cast Firespout and 3 damage to each creature with flying if {G} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{G} was spent.)

name: Fossil Find
text: Return a card at random from your graveyard to your hand, then reorder your graveyard as you choose.
flavor: "Some secrets want to be revealed. They burst through the soil of their own accord."\n—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Giantbaiting
text: Put a 4/4 red and green Giant Warrior creature token with haste onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it.)

name: Guttural Response
text: Counter target blue instant spell.
flavor: Wort had a raiding-bellow that could shatter steel, melt auras, and slice countermagic in half.

name: Impromptu Raid
text: {2}{R/G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it isn't a creature card, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, put that card onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: For the Scuzzback gang, it's always "raid o'clock."

name: Loamdragger Giant
flavor: Giants sleep soundly and long, sometimes for long enough that a crust of earth and moss grows over them. But inevitably something disturbs their slumber, and they wake unhappy.

name: Manamorphose
text: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool.\nDraw a card.
flavor: For a moment, objects of pure mana glimmered in the wonderstruck boggart's hands. In the next moment, they were in his mouth, as he chewed contentedly.

name: Morselhoarder
text: Morselhoarder enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.\nRemove a -1/-1 counter from Morselhoarder: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
flavor: It scours the hills for living matter, savoring even the tang of poisonous fungi.

name: Mudbrawler Raiders
text: Mudbrawler Raiders can't be blocked by blue creatures.
flavor: To reach the ravine of the Wanderbrine River, they were told to take the shortcut "through the mountains." They took the directions literally.

name: Rosheen Meanderer
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only on costs that contain {X}.
flavor: Night after night, Rosheen babbled about a bygone sunlit world, her every word dismissed as a madwoman's ravings.

name: Runes of the Deus
text: Enchant creature\nAs long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)\nAs long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has trample.

name: Scuzzback Marauders
text: Trample\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Scuzzback Scrapper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: The Scuzzback gang scavenges rusty armor covered in barbed protrusions. No threat is more effective than the threat of infection.

name: Tattermunge Duo
text: Whenever you cast a red spell, Tattermunge Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nWhenever you cast a green spell, Tattermunge Duo gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

name: Tattermunge Maniac
text: Tattermunge Maniac attacks each turn if able.
flavor: It shows up at one meal wearing the carcass of the last.

name: Tattermunge Witch
text: {R}{G}: Each blocked creature gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: The Tattermunge gang has no words for the spell that whips their instinctual rage into a frenzy. They only know they like it.

name: Valleymaker
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Mountain: Valleymaker deals 3 damage to target creature.\n{T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Choose a player. That player adds {G}{G}{G} to his or her mana pool.
flavor: Their home uprooted by a giant, the gang of boggarts mourned their old stomping ground.

name: Vexing Shusher
text: Vexing Shusher can't be countered.\n{R/G}: Target spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.
flavor: The stench of bloodcap mushrooms on the breath is enough to ward off even the most potent magics, especially when combined with a special chant: "Hushhh."

name: Wort, the Raidmother
text: When Wort, the Raidmother enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 red and green Goblin Warrior creature tokens onto the battlefield.\nEach red or green instant or sorcery spell you cast has conspire. (As you cast the spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose new targets for the copy.)

name: Barkshell Blessing
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.\nConspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Dawnglow Infusion
text: You gain X life if {G} was spent to cast Dawnglow Infusion and X life if {W} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {G}{W} was spent.)
flavor: Dawnglove bloom is a potent nostrum, but the dawnglow brewed from its sap is nothing less than life itself.

name: Elvish Hexhunter
text: {G/W}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Hexhunter: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: "All manner of curses, blights, and luckspoils infect Shadowmoor. We stalk them, one perilous quest at a time."

name: Fracturing Gust
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments. You gain 2 life for each permanent destroyed this way.
flavor: Elvish dawnhands test a relic's worthiness before collecting it for the safehold. If it can't stand up to a stiff breeze, it's left behind.

name: Heartmender
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from each creature you control.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Kitchen Finks
text: When Kitchen Finks enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.\nPersist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
flavor: Accept one favor from an ouphe, and you're doomed to accept another.

name: Medicine Runner
text: When Medicine Runner enters the battlefield, you may remove a counter from target permanent.
flavor: Elvish healers carry vials of the balm known as dawnglow, reserving it for those wounds that herbs cannot treat.

name: Mercy Killing
text: Target creature's controller sacrifices it, then puts X 1/1 green and white Elf Warrior creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that creature's power.
flavor: "We will give you the peace you seek, though you may not yet know you seek it."

name: Old Ghastbark
flavor: "Beware of trees that talk. Their words are threats. And mind the ones that sway and creak. They too threaten us, but in a foreign tongue."\n—The Book of Other Folk

name: Oracle of Nectars
text: {X}, {T}: You gain X life.
flavor: When elves find a fount of beauty, they protect it. Where there is beauty, there is hope.

name: Oversoul of Dusk
text: Protection from blue, from black, and from red
flavor: "Some say she hid the sun herself, a desperate act to save it from its ultimate extinction."\n—The Seer's Parables

name: Raven's Run Dragoon
text: Raven's Run Dragoon can't be blocked by black creatures.
flavor: "I have a gift. The ability to sense encroaching darkness has saved many lives. And yet constantly feeling the force of so much ugliness is a terrible burden."

name: Reknit
text: Regenerate target permanent.
flavor: "An axe may break upon a ribbon if the ribbon's will is the stronger."\n—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Rhys the Redeemed
text: {2}{G/W}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green and white Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.\n{4}{G/W}{G/W}, {T}: For each creature token you control, put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield.
flavor: Whole again in honor and horn.

name: Safehold Duo
text: Whenever you cast a green spell, Safehold Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nWhenever you cast a white spell, Safehold Duo gains vigilance until end of turn.

name: Safehold Elite
text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
flavor: "I refuse to die—not at the hands of one such as you."

name: Safewright Quest
text: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Elves search for sources of beauty in a nighted world. Meanwhile, the nighted world searches for the blood of elves.

name: Seedcradle Witch
text: {2}{G}{W}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
flavor: She whispered a prayer for strength, and her wishes wafted away like seeds on the wind.

name: Shield of the Oversoul
text: Enchant creature\nAs long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. If its toughness is 0 or less, it's still put into its owner's graveyard.)\nAs long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

name: Wheel of Sun and Moon
text: Enchant player\nIf a card would be put into enchanted player's graveyard from anywhere, instead that card is revealed and put on the bottom of that player's library.
flavor: Every life ends, but life itself never does.

name: Wilt-Leaf Cavaliers
text: Vigilance
flavor: Every elf in Shadowmoor is charged from birth with a terrible duty: to strike back against the ugliness and darkness, even though they are all around and seemingly without end.

name: Wilt-Leaf Liege
text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.\nOther white creatures you control get +1/+1.\nIf a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Wilt-Leaf Liege, put it onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your graveyard.

name: Blazethorn Scarecrow
text: Blazethorn Scarecrow has haste as long as you control a red creature.\nBlazethorn Scarecrow has wither as long as you control a green creature. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Blight Sickle
text: Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has wither. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nEquip {2}
flavor: Its scars cut deeper than its blade.

name: Cauldron of Souls
text: {T}: Choose any number of target creatures. Each of those creatures gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Chainbreaker
text: Chainbreaker enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.\n{3}, {T}: Remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature.
flavor: Scarecrows deemed too malevolent to roam free are shackled to boulders or dolmen stones. Their animosity usually outlives the chains.

name: Elsewhere Flask
text: When Elsewhere Flask enters the battlefield, draw a card.\nSacrifice Elsewhere Flask: Choose a basic land type. Each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.
flavor: One night Oona bottled the sky. The next night she aligned the stars and released it.

name: Gnarled Effigy
text: {4}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "Bits of fallen scarecrow, laces of elfskin leather, teeth of an axeshark merrow . . . An industrious soul can find new uses for the most mundane items."\n—Mowagh the Gwyllion

name: Grim Poppet
text: Grim Poppet enters the battlefield with three -1/-1 counters on it.\nRemove a -1/-1 counter from Grim Poppet: Put a -1/-1 counter on another target creature.
flavor: Beware a scarecrow bearing gifts—especially sloshing vessels of acid.

name: Heap Doll
text: Sacrifice Heap Doll: Exile target card from a graveyard.
flavor: "I know one night it won't come back. Then I'll know it's truly done its job."\n—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Illuminated Folio
text: {1}, {T}, Reveal two cards from your hand that share a color: Draw a card.
flavor: Most such relics remain clasped shut for fear of what ominous truths might be carved into the diptych inside.

name: Lockjaw Snapper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nWhen Lockjaw Snapper dies, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.

name: Lurebound Scarecrow
text: As Lurebound Scarecrow enters the battlefield, choose a color.\nWhen you control no permanents of the chosen color, sacrifice Lurebound Scarecrow.
flavor: It's a fool's race to run if all is lost if it be won.

name: Painter's Servant
text: As Painter's Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color.\nAll cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.
flavor: It gathers hues from the twilight mist so that its master can paint a better world.

name: Pili-Pala
text: Flying\n{2}, {Q}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: It wasn't really expected to fly. Then again, it wasn't expected to move, either.

name: Rattleblaze Scarecrow
text: Rattleblaze Scarecrow has persist as long as you control a black creature. (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)\nRattleblaze Scarecrow has haste as long as you control a red creature.

name: Reaper King
text: ({2/W} can be paid with any two mana or with {W}. This card's converted mana cost is 10.)\nOther Scarecrow creatures you control get +1/+1.\nWhenever another Scarecrow enters the battlefield under your control, destroy target permanent.
flavor: It's harvest time.

name: Revelsong Horn
text: {1}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: A deflated sigh breathed into the horn emerges as an inspiring melody.

name: Scrapbasket
text: {1}: Scrapbasket becomes all colors until end of turn.
flavor: Once a tool of kithkin farmers, scarecrows of all shapes now skitter and lurch across Shadowmoor, animated by residual rustic magics.

name: Scuttlemutt
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.\n{T}: Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Built to shuttle goods from the river, it took off one day carrying a cauldron of dyes.

name: Tatterkite
text: Flying\nTatterkite can't have counters placed on it.
flavor: "I rigged it together from wicker and scrap, yet somehow I find it unalterably perfect."\n—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Thornwatch Scarecrow
text: Thornwatch Scarecrow has wither as long as you control a green creature. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)\nThornwatch Scarecrow has vigilance as long as you control a white creature.

name: Trip Noose
text: {2}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.

name: Umbral Mantle
text: Equipped creature has "{3}, {Q}: This creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn." ({Q} is the untap symbol.)\nEquip {0}
flavor: It harnesses the power of night in a land where daylight fears to show itself.

name: Watchwing Scarecrow
text: Watchwing Scarecrow has vigilance as long as you control a white creature.\nWatchwing Scarecrow has flying as long as you control a blue creature.
flavor: The wings are held in place by wicker rods. The rods are held in place by pure faith.

name: Wicker Warcrawler
text: Whenever Wicker Warcrawler attacks or blocks, put a -1/-1 counter on it at end of combat.
flavor: It's the twisted creation of a kithkin diviner who dreamed of very large crows.

name: Wingrattle Scarecrow
text: Wingrattle Scarecrow has flying as long as you control a blue creature.\nWingrattle Scarecrow has persist as long as you control a black creature. (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Fire-Lit Thicket
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{R/G}, {T}: Add {R}{R}, {R}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.
flavor: Occupancy of the den changes from night to night as boggart gangs fight for control of a place they aren't willing to simply eat.

name: Graven Cairns
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{B/R}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{R}, or {R}{R} to your mana pool.
flavor: "Here did the Extinguisher steal the light from the world. Here will we sacrifice her to bring the Great Rekindling to our people."\n—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Leechridden Swamp
text: ({T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.)\nLeechridden Swamp enters the battlefield tapped.\n{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more black permanents.

name: Madblind Mountain
text: ({T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.)\nMadblind Mountain enters the battlefield tapped.\n{R}, {T}: Shuffle your library. Activate this ability only if you control two or more red permanents.

name: Mistveil Plains
text: ({T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.)\nMistveil Plains enters the battlefield tapped.\n{W}, {T}: Put target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library. Activate this ability only if you control two or more white permanents.

name: Moonring Island
text: ({T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.)\nMoonring Island enters the battlefield tapped.\n{U}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. Activate this ability only if you control two or more blue permanents.

name: Mystic Gate
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{W/U}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{U}, or {U}{U} to your mana pool.
flavor: The gate of every kithkin doun is a cunning trap, intended to spill visitors into an oubliette from which there is no escape.

name: Reflecting Pool
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.
flavor: Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

name: Sapseep Forest
text: ({T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.)\nSapseep Forest enters the battlefield tapped.\n{G}, {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more green permanents.

name: Sunken Ruins
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{U/B}, {T}: Add {U}{U}, {U}{B}, or {B}{B} to your mana pool.
flavor: Without the care of the tideshapers, the Lanes lie neglected. Some have flooded entire towns; others dried to cracked mud.

name: Wooded Bastion
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{G/W}, {T}: Add {G}{G}, {G}{W}, or {W}{W} to your mana pool.
flavor: The elves of Wilt-Leaf Wood continually expand the palisade surrounding the sanctuary. They hope to one day enclose the entire forest within its walls.
